datasets.name: data.csv
datasets.description: Related to celestial bodies, galaxies, and space phenomena.

columns.name: cosmic_radiation_level
columns.description: Average level of cosmic radiation in the galaxy, measured in microsieverts per hour (µSv/h)

columns.name: dominant_stellar_age
columns.description: Average age of the dominant stellar population in the galaxy, measured in millions of years

columns.name: dark_matter_density_classification
columns.description: Binary classification of dark matter density in the region

columns.name: supernova_rate
columns.description: Number of supernovae observed per year in the galaxy

columns.name: gravity_rule_index
columns.description: A score indicating the strength of gravitational pull within the galaxy

columns.name: number_of_satellite_galaxies
columns.description: The count of smaller galaxies gravitationally bound to the main galaxy

columns.name: star_density
columns.description: Number of stars per unit volume in the galaxy

columns.name: proximity_to_black_hole
columns.description: Distance of the galaxy from the nearest black hole in light years

columns.name: galaxy_spectral_redshift
columns.description: Measure of the galaxy's redshift indicating the speed at which it is moving away

columns.name: cosmic_structures
columns.description: Number of larger cosmic structures within the vicinity of the galaxy

columns.name: average_orbital_velocity
columns.description: The average velocity at which celestial bodies orbit the center of the galaxy, measured in kilometers per second

columns.name: magnetic_field_strength
columns.description: Measure of the galaxy's average magnetic field strength in gauss

columns.name: has_active_galactic_nucleus
columns.description: Indicates whether the galaxy has an active galactic nucleus

columns.name: velocity_dispersion_of_stars
columns.description: Statistical spread in velocities of stars within the galaxy, in km/s

columns.name: blue_signature_intensity
columns.description: Measure of blue light intensity from the galaxy

columns.name: gravitational_pull
columns.description: The combined gravitational force exerted by nearby celestial bodies, measured in multiples of Earth's gravity

columns.name: passive_star_nuclei
columns.description: Count of galaxies in a cluster with passive or dormant galactic nuclei

columns.name: stellar_density
columns.description: Number of stars per cubic light year in the galaxy

columns.name: galaxy_ID
columns.description: Unique identifier for each galaxy

columns.name: distance_to_galactic_center
columns.description: The distance of the galaxy from the galactic center in light years

columns.name: binary_star_systems_percentage
columns.description: Percentage of star systems in the galaxy that are binary or multiple star systems

columns.name: central_black_hole_presence
columns.description: Indicates whether there is a supermassive black hole at the center of the galaxy

columns.name: ultraviolet_emission
columns.description: Indicator whether the galaxy has significant ultraviolet emission, binary true/false

columns.name: galaxy_age
columns.description: Estimated age of the galaxy in billions of years

columns.name: orbital_companions
columns.description: Number of smaller celestial bodies or satellites orbiting the galaxy

columns.name: cosmic_radiation_percentile
columns.description: Relative percentile rank of a galaxy based on detected cosmic radiation levels

columns.name: presence_exotic_matter
columns.description: Binary status indicating if exotic matter is significantly present within the galaxy

columns.name: nova_light_emission_intensity
columns.description: Mean intensity of light emissions from nova events near the galaxy measured in lumens.

columns.name: magnetic_field_presence
columns.description: Indicator of the presence of significant magnetic fields in the galaxy

columns.name: luminous_blue_variable_count
columns.description: Number of luminous blue variables in the galaxy

columns.name: number_of_nebulae
columns.description: Count of the nebulae within the galaxy

columns.name: interstellar_gas_mass
columns.description: Total mass of interstellar gas in the galaxy measured in solar masses

columns.name: cluster_region
columns.description: Assigned cluster region of space for the galaxy

columns.name: star_forming_region_proximity
columns.description: Closeness of the galaxy to nearest star-forming regions, measured in light years

columns.name: binary_star_systems
columns.description: Number of binary star systems observed in the galaxy

columns.name: active_star_nuclei
columns.description: Count of galaxies in a cluster with active galactic nuclei

columns.name: star_formation_rate
columns.description: Rate of star formation in the galaxy measured in solar masses per year

columns.name: luminosity_variability
columns.description: Fluctuation degree of galaxy's luminosity over a 10-year period, measured as the standard deviation of luminosity

columns.name: proportion_of_red_stars
columns.description: Proportion of red stars compared to total stars in the galaxy

columns.name: variable_stellar_types_ratio
columns.description: The ratio of variable star types to total star count within the galaxy

columns.name: high_radiation_levels
columns.description: Binary indicator of whether the galaxy is exposed to high levels of cosmic radiation

columns.name: distance_to_nearest_star_forming_region
columns.description: Distance from the galactic center to the nearest star-forming region measured in light-years

columns.name: metallic_content_percentage
columns.description: Average percentage of metals found in stars within the galaxy.

columns.name: distance_to_galactic_core
columns.description: Distance of the galaxy from the nearest galactic core in light years

columns.name: has_binary_star_system
columns.description: Binary status indicating if the galaxy contains a binary star system

columns.name: average_surface_temperature_of_stars
columns.description: Average surface temperature of the dominant stars within the galaxy, in Kelvin

queries.question: What is the relationship between the distance to the nearest star-forming region, star formation rate, presence of magnetic fields, dominant stellar age, luminosity variability, average surface temperature, ultraviolet emission, and dark matter density classification in respect to the count of luminous blue variables in galaxies with varying levels of complexity?
